results.ActivityTitleGREEK: Ανακαλύψτε
results.ActivityInstructions:
Discover something new to ignite your thinking about the global macro environment.

  1. Go to the Resources tab and watch the media programs. Take notes as you watch.

  2. Consider how you might answer the following questions:
    • If a country with high inequality rates cannot produce high growth rates, how can BRIC`s (the five emerging economies of Brazil, Russia, India and China) boom during the past few years be explained?​
    • Do you believe that inequality is a political—or an economical—issue? Why?
    • Can a high population growth rate boost the economic growth rate of a country?​ If so, how? If not, why not?
    • Does a shrinking working population explain Europe’s anemic growth? If so, how? If not, why not?

  3. Search the Internet and your school library for information that will help you to answer these questions.

  4. Go to the Collaborate tab and create a new Discussion post. In your post, share your answers to the questions and links to any websites you found that helped you to answer the questions.

  5. Click on your peers' Discussion posts and read through them. Select at least two peers and comment on their posts in a way that builds on their discovery thinking.
results.ActivityInstructionsGREEK:
Ανακαλύψτε κάτι νέο για να δώσετε έναυσμα στους στοχασμούς σας για Ανακαλύψτε.

ΟΔΗΓΙΕΣ:

Μεταβείτε στην καρτέλα Πηγές και παρακολουθήστε τα προγράμματα πολυμέσων. Κρατήστε σημειώσεις ενόσω παρακολουθείτε.

Σκεφτείτε τι απαντήσεις θα δίνατε στις εξής ερωτήσεις:

  • Αν μια χώρα με υψηλά ποσοστά ανισότητας δεν μπορεί να επιτύχει υψηλούς ρυθμούς ανάπτυξης, πώς μπορεί να εξηγηθεί η οικονομική ανάπτυξη των χωρών BRICS (των πέντε αναδυόμενων οικονομιών της Βραζιλίας, της Ρωσίας, της Ινδίας, της Κίνας και της Νότιας Αφρικής) στη διάρκεια των προηγούμενων ετών;
  • Είναι η ανισότητα πολιτικό ή οικονομικό ζήτημα;
  • Μπορεί η μεγάλη αύξηση του πληθυσμού να δώσει ώθηση στο ρυθμό οικονομικής ανάπτυξης μιας χώρας;
  • Η συρρίκνωση του ενεργού πληθυσμού μπορεί να εξηγήσει την αναιμική ανάπτυξη στην Ευρώπη
Αναζητήστε στο διαδίκτυο και στη βιβλιοθήκη της σχολής σας πληροφορίες που θα σας βοηθήσουν να απαντήσετε σε αυτές τις ερωτήσεις.

Μεταβείτε στην καρτέλα Συνεργασία και δημιουργήστε μια νέα δημοσίευση συζήτησης. Στη δημοσίευσή σας, μοιραστείτε τις απαντήσεις που δώσατε στις ερωτήσεις καθώς και τυχόν συνδέσμους που βρήκατε και οι οποίοι σας βοήθησαν να απαντήσετε στις ερωτήσεις.

Επιλέξτε τις δημοσιεύσεις συζήτησης των συμφοιτητών σας και κατόπιν διαβάστε τις. Επιλέξτε τουλάχιστον δύο συμφοιτητές και σχολιάστε τις δημοσιεύσεις τους με τρόπο εποικοδομητικό για τις ανακαλύψεις στις οποίες η σκέψη τους τούς οδήγησε.

results.ActivityInstructions:
Discover something new to ignite your thinking about the impact of the Internet on daily life.

  1. Go to the Resources tab and watch the media programs. Take notes as you watch.

  2. Consider how you might answer the following questions:
    • Imagine a world without the internet. What do you envision as some of the major impacts on such elements as financial services and retail distribution?
    • What do you think would be  the impact of a lack of an internet on companies’ supply chains?​
    • Criminal elements often make use of the internet in such a way that democratic governments might face the decision of taking control over the web. How might government and law enforcement agencies impact your business if such decisions are made?​
      ​
  3. Search the Internet and your school library for information that will help you to answer these questions.

  4. Go to the Collaborate tab and create a new Discussion post. In your post, share your answers to the questions and links to any websites you found that helped you to answer the questions.

  5. Click on your peers' Discussion posts and read through them. Select at least two peers and comment on their posts in a way that builds on their discovery thinking.

results.ActivityInstructions:
Discover something new to ignite your thinking about digital technology dependence.

  1. Go to the Resources tab and watch the media programs. Take notes as you watch.

  2. Consider how you might answer the following questions:
    • What solutions can you propose to avoid excessive use of technology, such as addiction to internet use?
    • Do you think that regularly "disconnecting" from personal internet use is a good or bad practice for end users? Explain.
    • How would you feel if a law was introduced that restricted Internet usage to one hour per day in two hour periods of the day?

  3. Search the Internet and your school library for information that will help you to answer these questions.

  4. Go to the Collaborate tab and create a new Discussion post. In your post, share your answers to the questions and links to any websites you found that helped you to answer the questions.

  5. Click on your peers' Discussion posts and read through them. Select at least two peers and comment on their posts in a way that builds on their discovery thinking.

results.ActivityInstructions:
Develop your personal interest in an aspect of the gloal macro environment and trends through critical thinking and private coaching from your faculty.

An appropriate analysis of the global macro environment is a crucial first step in understanding the evolution of the customer environment. 

  1. Go to the Resources tab and review all of the Mandatory Resources.

  2. Select one Mandatory Resource that captures your personal interest.

  3. Go to the Collaborate tab and create a new Discussion post. In your post, write a brief critique of the Mandatory Resource you selected. Begin your post by identifying the resource and explaining why you selected it.

  4. Read your faculty's comments and engage in further discussion with your faculty to deepen your understanding and expand your critical thinking in this area.

results.ActivityInstructions:
Demonstrate your group's understanding of brand identity by writing a paper in which you evaluate and compare the methods two companies have used to establish brand identity.

Developing a brand identity and an engaging brand narrative has always been an important marketing strategy. However, the digital age has added another dimension to brand development. Current technologies have ‘democratised’ the tools needed to create a strong brand. Now, anyone with access to a computer or smartphone can participate in how brands are created and maintained. This not only allows both large and small companies to invest in building the stories of their brands, it also allows consumers to shape how a company develops its brand.

  1. Write a 2 - to 3 – page paper in which you do the following:​
    • ​​Select two companies: one that built a brand prior to the Internet being a marketing tool, and another that formed at or near the beginning of the use of the Internet as a marketing tool.
    • For each company, explain how one built its brand without the use of traditional advertising in the pre-Internet age and compare that strategy to how the other company has built its brand in the Internet age.
    • Then explain how both companies can use new tools to develop their brands “for free”— strategically cultivating an engaged customer base without investing heavily in traditional advertising.
  2. ​Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.
  3. Go to the Submission tab and submit your deliverable by the due date.

results.ActivityTitle: Is Technology a Source of Competitive Advantage
results.ActivityInstructions:
​

Discover something new to ignite your thinking about how technology should be considered as an asset and a source of competitive advantage and how does one keep up with all the changes.

​1. Go to the Resources tab and watch the media programs. Take notes as you watch.

2. Consider how you might answer the following questions:

  • What exactly does 'Technology Watch' mean? What is it for?
  • Why do we need to monitor technology to innovate our businesses? 
  • Is technology research a human/costumer behaviour?
  • Should we follow the technology leaders or be aware of new players? Why?

3. Search the Internet and your school library for information that will help you to answer these questions.

4. ​Go to the Collaborate tab and create a new Discussion post. In your post, share your answers to the questions and links to any websites you found that helped you to answer the questions.

5.  Click on your peers' Discussion posts and read through them. Select ​ at least two peers and comment on their posts in a way that builds on their discovery thinking.

results.ActivityTitle: Regional Innovation Systems and Revolutionized Sectors: The Mobile Gaming and Digital Music
results.ActivityInstructions:
Demonstrate your group's understanding of regional innovation systems by writing a report and conducting research.

 

  1. Go to the Resources tab and review the resources associated with the activity.
  2. Do research on your own to learn more about this topic.
  3. Go to the Collaborate tab and look for a new Discussion post your faculty (or designated peer) created as the main discussion for this activity.
  4. Within that main Discussion area, do the following:
      • Collaborate with your group and complete the following:
      • Reflect on the following summaries:
        • Practical Managerial Implications:  The study provides a framework for managers to develop new products that merges boundaries of related industries and encourages network-based innovation and cooperation between industry players, involving different regions. You are expected to show new opportunities based on the Ansoff Matrix theory of diversification, while identifying a prioritisation of different strategic choices that may be attached to each stage of the Ansoff Matrix (short, medium and long run). You should provide examples and justify their views. 
        • Social Implications:  The study considers implicitly that social capital network is key for innovation and knowledge spillover among industry players. Content creation regarding products and services show high dependence on spatial external cultural influences, tastes and habits for customer-centric innovation, while impacting social and learning customer experience as well. How would you discuss the potential divide between cultural, taste and habits for customer-centric and global innovation approaches at the same time? You should justify their answers and provide examples.
        • How the Industry Life Cycle Will Evolve in the Future: Based on assumptions and managerial dynamics showed in the case, discuss ways by which the industry life cycle will be influenced in the result of the technological convergence that is occurring for both industries (mobile gaming and digital music).
        • Write a 1.500-word report and provide examples to justify your group's answer as you analyse the main effects regarding:
          • Industry dynamics and bargaining power among the different players
          • Sales growth potential
          • Profit growth potential
          • Innovation time span
          • Monetisation of the new product/service

  5. Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.
  6. Select one person from your group to go to the Submission tab and submit the group's deliverable by the due date.

​Discover something new to ignite your thinking about ​developing loyalty plans.

DIRECTIONS:

Go to the Resources tab and watch the media programs. Take notes as you watch.

Consider how you might answer the following questions:

And if businesses do not present extra advantages, such as customer reward programs, incentives, or the so-called ‘loyalty cards’, others will. But in this game, who has to be loyal to whom? results.ActivityInstructions:
​Demonstrate your group’s understanding of developing a loyalty plan by creating a presentation to pitch a loyalty program.  

DIRECTIONS:​​

  1. ​Go to the Collaborate tab and look for a new Discussion post your faculty (or designated peer) created as the main discussion for this activity.​
  2. Within that main Discussion area, your group has to pitch a loyalty program to a small business owner. First, your group must select one of the businesses below:
    • A coffee shop: This local, urban coffee shop caters to the workers at local businesses and students. There is a small sit-down area, but almost 90% of patrons get their coffee to go. The shop also sells a small selection of pastries and breads that are made on site. Their shop has been rated highly on several websites as one of the 10 best coffee shops in town. The owners believe it is the atmosphere, location and bakery items that differentiate their brand from the competition. They do not have data to verify this belief.
    • A gym: This local gym requires a low monthly fee to access fitness equipment, a common workout area, a basketball court and squash courts. Members pay extra for personal trainers and for group classes. The gym's membership is 40% male and 60% female. They do not keep records on age groups. The owners think most members are between the ages of 20 and 40.
    • A food truck: Two sisters own a food truck that serves Indian food. Forty per cent of their revenue comes from lunch-hour foot traffic during weekdays; 15% comes from foot traffic at dinner time; and 45% comes from events and festival venues. They have been operating for about 8 months, and they think they have been cultivating a loyal following based on their informal interactions with repeat customers. However, they cannot accurately measure how many repeat customers they have.

  3. ​​Each of these businesses is looking to create a loyalty plan. They are unsure about whether the costs of developing and maintaining a loyalty program are worth it, how to identify and take advantage of brand ambassadors, whether or not a social media platform would work for them or how to segment their target customers in the loyalty program.
  4. Once your group selects a business, you have to develop your pitch: a 4–6 slide presentation that shows:
    • How the time spent on developing and maintaining a loyalty program impacts client loyalty
    • How to identify and leverage brand ambassadors
    • Two options for the business:
    • How to use a social media platform for a loyalty plan that strengthens ties with its target customers
    • How to develop a loyalty plan that does not require a social media platform
    • How to segment the loyalty program based on generational differences among their target customers
    • Your final recommendations for a loyalty program for the business you selected
    • Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.​​

Select one person from your group to go to the Submission tab and submit the group’s deliverable by the due date.

results.ActivityInstructions:
​Demonstrate your individual understanding of loyalty by writing a paper in which you describe and compare types of loyalty.

DIRECTIONS:

For this individual essay, you will need to research your university library and the internet to find information about the following types of loyalties:

  • Contractual Loyalty – through a contract, your customer is obligated to use your service or product for either duration of the contract or until the customer pays to leave the contract.
  • Transactional Loyalty - the ability to retain customers who are not contractually obligated to stay with you
  • Functional Loyalty - similar to emotional loyalty, this type of loyalty refers to satisfying the basic expectations of customers so that your product or service comes first to mind. However, the customer’s loyalty is fragile and may switch to a cheaper or more convenient substitute.
  • Emotional Loyalty - A customer connects emotionally to your product or service in a way that makes them feel good for purchasing it.​

Once you have researched each of these loyalties, write a 1,000 word essay that provides the following:

  • Definitions and recent examples of each loyalty
  • The trade-offs associated with each kind of loyalty
  • How companies can balance the 4 loyalties to cultivate customer loyalty​

Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.

Go to the Submission tab and submit your deliverable by the due date.​

results.ActivityTitle: Analysis of The Internet of Things
results.ActivityInstructions:
The Internet of Things (IoT) is a concept that illustrates the connection between your smartphone, your refrigerator, your grocery supplier, your bank, and other “things” that can be inter-connected via the web. It is a network of objects connected via electronic sensors, and gains form from technological convergence. Beginning with RFID tags for supply chain purposes, the IoT has evolved for georeferencing, locating people, security, surveillance and the ability to control distant objects.
 
While many technicians and scientists believe that the Internet of Things is a great step into a better world, many others have great doubts about it. Consider this debate as you complete the following:

  1. Review the resources associated with the activity.
  2. Do research on your own to learn more about this topic
  3. Complete the following:
    • ​Write a 1.000 word paper in which you explain the strong and weak points of the concept, as well as future applications and doubts or constraints it can carry. 
Submit your deliverable to your faculty.​

results.ActivityInstructions:
Develop your personal interest in an aspect of ​customer data through critical thinking and private coaching from your faculty.

Customer behaviours and demands are subject to change according to market conditions and available services. The modern customer demands goods and services now. 

Marketing is more than customer centric, it is customer needs centric. And to sustain that centricity, marketing follows behavioural techniques in trying to understand how it is possible to influence consumers. Without such insights, marketing will fail to present valuable offers, and companies’ competitiveness will drop. 
  1. Go to the Resources tab and review all of the Mandatory Resources.
  2. Select one Mandatory Resource that captures your personal interest. 
  3. Go to the Collaborate tab and create a new Discussion post. In your post, write a brief critique of the Mandatory Resource you selected. Begin your post by identifying the resource and explaining why you selected it.

Read your faculty's comments and engage in further discussion with your faculty to deepen your understanding and expand your critical thinking in this area.​

results.ActivityInstructions:
Discover something new to ignite your thinking about the costs of quality.

DIRECTIONS:

  1. ​Go to the Resources tab and watch the media programs. Take notes as you watch.
  2. Consider how you might answer the following questions:
  • Quality systems can cost a lot of money, but what has been the cost when a product, service or system failed at your company, or one with which you are familiar? What were the consequences of the failure to meet quality?
  • Sometimes businesses can receive quality via suppliers, but suppliers can also transmit poor quality to a business. How would you develop an accreditation system for suppliers to ensure they add the quality your company needs?
  1. Search the Internet and your school library for information that will help you to answer these questions.
  2. Go to the Collaborate tab and create a new Discussion post. In your post, share your answers to the questions and links to any websites you found that helped you to answer the questions.
  3. Click on your peers' Discussion posts and read through them. Select at least two peers and comment on their posts in a way that builds on their discovery thinking.

results.ActivityTitle: Building Customer Satisfaction with Internal and External Customers
results.ActivityInstructions:
​From your professional experience, you know that it can be difficult to satisfy the 'internal customer' and achieve employee engagement that benefits external customers Talk with your peers to increase your understanding of how to make this possible.

  1. Go to the Resources tab and review the resources associated with the activity.
  2. Do research on your own to learn more about this topic.
  3. Go to the Collaborate tab and look for a new Discussion post your faculty (or designated peer) created as the main discussion for this activity.
  4. Within that main Discussion area, answer the following questions:

    • What suggestions do you have on how to build good customer satisfaction with your internal customers?
    • How would you ensure your suggestions will translate to better engagement with external customers?
​​​​​Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.​
​​

​

Discover something new to ignite your thinking about the costs of quality.

DIRECTIONS:

 

  1. Go to the Resources tab and watch the media programs. Take notes as you watch.
  2. Consider how you might answer the following questions:
    • What is the difference between customer centricity and customer service? Do some research on your own to answer these questions.
    • How much does your company invest in quality enhancement?
    • Is your quality program customer centric? If not, what adjustments would you make to it?
    • How much more value does a business provide if it has a customer-centric quality system?
  3. Search the Internet and your school library for information that will help you to answer these questions.
  4. Go to the Collaborate tab and create a new Discussion post. In your post, share your answers to the questions and links to any websites you found that helped you to answer the questions.

results.ActivityInstructions:
​

Contact and meaningful communication with internal and external customers is essential to improving or maintaining quality. But good communication, like quality, does not occur by accident. It must be planned for intentionally as part of the customer-centric process. Talk with your peers to increase your understanding of how to make this possible.

DIRECTIONS:

1.     Go to the Resources tab and review the resources associated with the activity.

2.     Do research on your own to learn more about this topic.

3.     Go to the Collaborate tab and look for a new Discussion post your faculty (or designated peer) created as the main discussion for this activity.

4.     Within that main Discussion area, answer the following questions:

    • How would a good internal communication plan contribute to decreasing of costs without compromising quality or external customer relationships?
    • Which is the best department to handle executing an internal communication plan: marketing, public relations, or human resources? In your answer, be sure to emphasise which department would be most responsive to improving relationships with external customers.

​Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.​

results.ActivityTitle: Do you know how to motivate your team?

results.ActivityInstructions:
Demonstrate your individual understanding of rewarding customer centricity by writing a paper in which you evaluate a reward and compensation system at a company.

Customer centricity requires a reward and compensation system within a company that incentivises employees and suppliers to deliver the quality solutions that the target customers want. In this activity, you write an essay in which you evaluate reward and compensation systems at a company of your choice.

DIRECTIONS:
1. Review the resources associated with the activity.
2. Do research on your own to learn more about this topic.
3. On your own, do the following:
    • Take a look at a company you have worked for, or one with which you would like to w​ork. 
    • Write an essay of approximately 1,000 words in which you evaluate how the reward and compensation system at the company makes it more, or less, customer centric. 
    • Recommend changes that can enhance the incentives for employees to be more customer-centric in the ways the company needs them to be. 
4. Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.
5. Go to the Submission tab and submit your deliverable by the due date.

results.ActivityTitle: People-Centred vs Place-Based Economic Policies – Balance Yes / Dichotomy No
results.ActivityInstructions:
​Talk with your peers to increase your understanding of economic policies.

  1. Go to the Resource tab and review the resources associated with the activity. 
  2. Go to the Collaborate tab and look for a new Discussion post your faculty (or designated peer) created as the main discussion for this activity.​ 
  3. Within that main Discussion area, reflect on the following issues:
      • On the one hand, economic policies should be 'people-centred' to maximise welfare; but on the other hand, 'place-based' increases innovation and productivity. But the point is that Regional Innovation Systems are focused on regions to allow maximum aggregate growth and welfare, and also spatial territorial dimensions and spillovers innovation. Moreover, whenever regions become more innovative, it means that organisations find more beneficial ground context to innovate and grow, as they are open systems, so that they can attract higher valuable human resources, high foreign direct investment and generate more productivity and innovation.
      • Formulate your opinion on how to reconcile those two different innovation policies and strategies.
  4. Include references to relevant resources for this activity and any other information that your group researched.

     

References:

Garcilazo, J., Martins, J. O., & Tompson, W. (2010). Why policies need to be place-based in order to be people-centred. Retrieved from http://voxeu.org/article/why-policies-may-need-be-place-based-order-be-people-centred ​

Atherton, A., & Johnston, A. (2008). Clusters formation from the 'bottom-up': a process perspective. In C. Karlsson (Ed.), Handbook of Research on Cluster Theory. Cheltenham, UK: Edward Elgar.​​

results.ActivityTitle: Smart Specialisation Strategies and Innovation Change
results.ActivityInstructions:
Talk with your peers to increase your understanding of smart specialisation strategies and how it effects innovation change.

  1. Go to the Resource tab and review the resources associated with the activity. 
  2. Go to the Collaborate tab and look for a new Discussion post your faculty (or designated peer) created as the main discussion for this activity. 
  3. Within that main Discussion area, read and analyze the following:
      • ​With the global financial and economic crisis and the euro debt crisis, the concept of smart specialisation has found an echo in the OECD discussions on 'New Industrial Policy', 'New Sources of Growth' and 'New Approaches to Economic Challenges' in order for countries and regions:
        • To 'go structural' to make economies more competitive
        • To 'go social' to address the increased inequality and lack of jobs
        • To 'go green' to promote a growth path that takes into account environmental constraints, without necessary tradeoffs between efficiency andcosts/consumption (e.g. green cities)
        • To 'go institutional' to address the current confidence and transparency gap in institutions and markets
      • Smart specialisation is a key framework that reached these goals by focusing on promoting structural change in the economy through investments in knowledge-based assets and better governance in STI policy making.
  4. Research how innovation policies and strategies at regional level influence innovation of organisations and their products and services.
  5. Select an industry and provide examples of innovation strategies on 'go social' and on 'smart specialisation'.
  6. Explain how these types of innovation strategies can influence innovation change of organisations.
  7. Provide examples and details on the type of products and services these organisations are innovating
  8. Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that your group researched.
​
Reference: 

Christensen, C. M. (2013). The innovator's dilemma: When new technologies cause great firms to fail. Boston, MA: Harvard Business School Press.​

results.ActivityInstructions:
Demonstrate your individual understanding of the case study by writing a paper, conducting individual research and reflecting on your practical experiences.

GE and Quirky GE also led the way through their partnership with the innovation community Quirky. This initially saw a number of GE patents offered to the Quirky community in the hope that they would be able to commercialise ideas and IP that GE themselves had been unable to. In addition, GE sought to support the Quirky community by engaging a selection of their own employees to assist with the development and implementation of new ideas being generated from this new arrangement, within the context of the broader GE organisation.

The goal of this was to both speed the introduction of these ideas and improve their success within the marketplace.

The fruits of this partnership began to emerge earlier this year as a number of products were developed around the smarter home. The focus on smart home technology was emphasised by the recent announcement that Quirky is opening a new micro-factory in San Francisco that will be a hub for developing the first built-to-order electronics for the smart home.

The new facility takes a leaf out of the TechShop handbook and comes equipped with facilities such as plastic injection molding lines, automated circuit board assembly machines and 3D printers.

These are two of a number of examples of organisations attempting to mesh together the innovators they have in house with the ideas and insights of the wider community. Other projects include BioCurious, GenSpace and Science Exchange in biotech research, and the numerous social innovation labs that are emerging around service sector topics.

  1. Go to the Resources tab and review the resources associated with the activity.
  2. Do research on your own to learn more about this topic.
  3. Complete the following:
    • ​Reflect on why this very innovative business model failed and analyse the reasons:
        • ​Why 'raw data' is considered a huge potential?
        • What is 'linked data'?
        • How is sharing and connecting data different from just sharing documents on the web?
      • ​​Write a 1.000-word report explaining why the business model failed and what the business could have done differently.
  4. Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.
  5. Go to the Submission tab and submit your deliverable by the due date.

results.ActivityTitle: Deep Dive Into New Product Development Techniques

results.ActivityTitle: Develop Guidelines for a Project Plan
results.ActivityInstructions:
Demonstrate your group's understanding of regional innovation systems by writing a report and conducting research. ​

  1. Go to the Resources tab and review the resources associated with the activity.

  2. Do research on your own to learn more about this topic.

  3. ​Go to the Collaborate tab and look for a new Discussion post your faculty (or designated peer) created as the main discussion for this activity.

  4. ​​Within that main Discussion area, do the following:​
      • ​​​Collaborate with your group and complete the following:
        • Define and develop a guideline list for a project plan in your company, defining tasks for major actors involved.
        • Develop a Word template for your company project plan regarding an actual issue related to a New Product Development (NPD) project.
        • Identify the market needs regarding a NPD project and establish relationships of the market needs with new product and service features.
        • Understand the priority order on the market needs and product/service features and then establish relationships among these features discuss trade-offs and design and develop the product and service prototype.
        • Develop the necessary project management activities to support the NPD.
  5.  ​Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.​

  6. ​Select one person from your group to go to the Submission tab and submit the group's deliverable by the due date.

Helpful Tools:​

results.ActivityInstructions:
Demonstrate your individual understanding of red ocean industries by creating a five- to eight-slide presentation that shows why the competitive parameters of this industry can be qualified as a red ocean. 

DIRECTIONS:
1. Go to the Resources tab and review all of the Mandatory Resources.
2. Do research on your own to learn more about this topic.
3. Create a five- to eight-slide presentation that includes:
  • A description of the industry, including an approximation of the value of the industry, major competitors, target markets, brief history of the industry, and the regulatory environment (1–3 slides)
  • A description of the forces that are shaping the competitive landscape within this industry (2–4 slides)
  • Your conclusions as to why this industry can be qualified as a red ocean (1–2 slides)
  • Include charts and visual aids if necessary
4. Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.
5. Go to the Submission tab and submit your deliverable by the due date.

results.ActivityInstructions:
​Demonstrate your group’s understanding of blue ocean competition by developing a blue ocean strategy for an industry. After choosing the industry, your group will collaborate and discuss what can be done to avoid the Red Ocean environment to create a Blue Ocean Strategy for this industry. For example, what must a company increase, decrease, eliminate, or create in order to carve out an uncontested space? Please use the Excel file in the Resources tab to help to create, co-develop, and demonstrate a viable Blue Ocean proposal. The group will submit one completed proposal as a PowerPoint presentation.


DIRECTIONS:

1. Go to the Resources tab and review all of the Mandatory Resources.
2. Go to the Collaborate tab and look for a new Discussion post your faculty (or designated peer) created as the main discussion for this activity.
3. Within that main Discussion area, complete a proposal for a blue ocean strategy of at least 12–15 slides, in which you do the following:
  • Provide a brief analysis of the competitive landscape of the industry (3–5 slides).
  • Describe the Blue Ocean Strategy you intend to pursue (1–2 slides).
  • List and describe the competitive factors you have used that define the competitive environment of the industry and the Blue Ocean space you have identified (3–6 slides).
  • Provide the table from the template that illustrates how the Blue Ocean Strategy you have selected separated your strategy from the competitive landscape (1 slide).
  • Justify why this differentiation can be an effective and successful Blue Ocean Strategy based on the parameters your group has selected (1–2 slides).
4. Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.

Select one person from your group to go to the Submission tab and submit the group’s deliverable by the due date.​

results.ActivityInstructions:
Talk with your peers to increase your understanding of learning from failure .For this activity, you choose a failing (or failed) company and discuss why it has failed by using arguments related to strategic execution and the Balanced Scorecard approach.

DIRECTIONS:

1. Go to the Resources tab and review the resources associated with the activity.
2. Do research on your own to learn more about this topic.
3. Go to the Collaborate tab and look for a new Discussion post your faculty (or designated peer) created as the main discussion for this activity.
4. Within that main Discussion area, answer the following questions:
  • What are the basic perspectives to execute corporate strategy? How can you link them to each other?
  • What was the strategy (or lack thereof) of the organisation you selected, and how did the strategy fail in terms of development, implementation or execution?
  • What were the challenges faced by the organisation you selected while executing its strategic plans?
  • How could the organisation have been structured differently based on its strategy? How could such a structure have changed the outcomes for the company? Please justify your arguments with examples.
  • How could you have measured, predicted, and adjusted corporate performance to change the outcome of the company? 
5. Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.

results.ActivityInstructions:
Demonstrate your group’s understanding of strategy execution by building a strategy map for an organisation.

DIRECTIONS:

1. Go to the Resources tab and review the resources associated with the activity.
2. Do research on your own to learn more about this topic.
3. Go to the Collaborate tab and look for a new Discussion post your faculty (or designated peer) created as the main discussion for this activity.
4. Within that main Discussion area, do the following:

  • Select a company and determine its strategic vision.
    • As a group, pick a company that you can research using open sources (press, annual reports, company newsletters, market data, etc.).
    • Discuss together to determine the company’s strategic vision. Some companies may have an explicit strategy they announce publicly. Other companies will require your group to research and determine what the strategic vision appears to be.
  • Collaborate to develop a potential Blue Ocean Strategy for the company.
    • Determine a Blue Ocean Strategy that will allow the company to build value while avoiding direct competition.
  • Build a Balanced Scorecard.
    • Based on your strategic choice (Blue Ocean), develop a strategic execution framework (Balanced Scorecard) for the company. You do not need to set numerical values/objectives for selected performance indicators; just make sure the perspectives and indicators are properly linked.
  • Build a strategy map.
    • Based on the Balanced Scorecard, build a strategy map. The chapter in ​​your resource, ‘Building Strategy Maps’ (Kaplan & Norton, 2000), provides suggestions for templates. You can also search the Internet for appropriate templates.
  • Submit a PowerPoint presentation as a group to your Faculty that includes:
    • Slide(s) that present the company and its strategic vision
    • Slide(s) that present the Blue Ocean Strategy that will allow the company to build value while avoiding direct competition
    • Slide(s) that present the Balanced Scorecard
    • Slide(s) that present the strategy map
5. Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.

Select one person from your group to go to the Submission tab and submit the group’s deliverable by the due date.

results.ActivityInstructions:
Demonstrate your group's understanding of  marketing tools and buying behaviour.

Today, digital marketing tools allow marketers to reach potential consumers in ways that would have been unthinkable only 20 years ago. Take a moment and reflect on the last significant purchase you made and the choices you had to make regarding the purchase. Each decision presents an opportunity for marketers to provide you with critical information about a particular brand or retailer. In the past, marketers had limited tools to reach out to consumers making buying decisions. However, by making information available on a variety of digital platforms, marketers provide easily accessible information that could influence your purchase in favour of a particular brand or retailer.​

DIRECTIONS:

Go to the Collaborate tab and look for a new Discussion post your faculty (or designated peer) created as the main discussion for this activity.

Within that main Discussion area, do the following:

  1. ​Consider your last major purchase, how you made your decision, how you accessed information, and how that product or service was marketed to you.
  2. Post an explanation of how you made your last major purchase. Your explanation should include how the product or service was marketed to you, how you interacted with the marketing tools, and the traditional and new marketing strategies that informed your purchasing decision.
  3. Then provide a list of recent digital marketing tools you have found through your research. Explain how these tools will likely impact your future purchasing decisions.
  4. Prepare a summary of your group's findings.
  5. Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.

Select one person from your group to go to the Submission tab and submit the group's deliverable by the due date.

Develop your personal interest in an aspect of relationship management via social media through critical thinking and private coaching from your faculty.

Many believe that the majority of customers spend a significant amount of time on social networks and social media. But it is difficult to measure exactly how much time is spent where, in what screen time and for how long. results.ActivityInstructions:
​According to entrepreneurs, three areas of an entrepreneurial ecosystem are of pivotal importance—accessible markets, human capital/workforce and funding and finance.

 

Within the ecosystem concept, companies with significant financial reserves benefit from the flexibility of acquiring many of the resources that help sustain their growth. On the other hand, entrepreneurs can also play an important role within the ecosystem, such as mentoring, self-investing or inspiring others.

 

Develop your personal interest in an aspect of entrepreneurial ecosystem through critical thinking and private coaching from your faculty.

  4. Read your faculty's comments and engage in further discussion with your faculty to deepen your understanding and expand your critical thinking in this area.

results.ActivityTitle: Case Study: Crowdfunding the Young Gallery Project
results.ActivityInstructions:
​The Glasgow-based charity Impact Arts was looking for alternative funding streams for its Young Gallery project. As a result, it undertook its first crowdfunding campaign on the Indiegogo platform. The project did not achieve its stated target of £15.000 in the 6-week campaign period. Instead, only £4.715 (31 per cent of the total) was raised. While the charity did not achieve its goal, the campaign left the chief executive officer and her team feeling motivated and enthusiastic about crowdfunding as a possible complementary revenue source. However, they recognised that they needed to learn from this experience in order to make future campaigns more effective with respect to pitch (the proposition made to would-be donors) and its delivery.

Demonstrate your group's understanding of the case study by writing a report and conducting research.

  1. Go to the Resources tab and review the resources associated with the activity.
     
  2. Do research on your own to learn more about this topic.
     
  3. Go to the Collaborate tab and look for a new Discussion post your faculty (or designated peer) created as the main discussion for this activity.

     
  4. Within that main Discussion area, do the following:

     
    1. Collaborate with your group and complete the following:
    2. Reflect on the following questions:
      • What makes crowdfunding an attractive new financing option for third-party, not-for-profit and for-profit organisations?
      • Given the type of project the Young Gallery represented, could Impact Arts have secured a better outcome using one of the other crowdfunding platforms? If so, how?
      • What are the average success rates for projects on the popular crowdfunding platforms?
    3. Write a 1.000-word report and provide examples
    4. Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.
       
  5. Select one person from your group to go to the Submission tab and submit the group's deliverable by the due date.

results.ActivityInstructions:
​Talk with your peers to increase your understanding of how HR can empower certain voices within an organization.

DIRECTIONS:

Go to the Resources tab and review all of the Mandatory Resources.

Go to the Collaborate tab and look for a new Discussion post your faculty (or designated peer) created as the main discussion for this activity.

Within that main Discussion area address the following:
  • Read the following paragraph by Marilyn French (1985) in her book Beyond Power: On Women, Men, and Morals.

It is therefore extremely ironic that patriarchy has upheld power as a good that is permanent and dependable, opposing it to the fluid, transitory goods of matricentry. Power has been exalted as the bulwark against pain, against the ephemerality of pleasure, but it is no bulwark, and is as ephemeral as any other part of life. Coercion seems a simpler, less time-consuming method of creating order than any other; yet it is just as time-consuming and tedious and far more expensive than personal encounter, persuasion, listening, and participating in bringing a group into harmony. None of this is unknown, unfamiliar, unperceived. Yet so strong is the mythology of power that we continue to believe, in the face of all evidence to the contrary, that it is substantial, that if we possessed enough of it we could be happy, that if some ‘great man’ possessed enough of it, he could make the world come right.

  • How does this this paragraph relate to how power and HR functions are described in your resources this week and how this power relates to HR policies in an organisation with which you are familiar. 
Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.

results.ActivityTitle: How Can the HR Functions Create Competitive Advantage?
results.ActivityInstructions:
Talk with your peers to increase your understanding of costs of how HR functions can create competitive advantage.

DIRECTIONS:

Go to the Resources tab and review all of the Mandatory Resources.

Review carefully the BSG Perspectives report: Creating People Advantage 2014-2015: How to Set Up Great HR Functions. In your review, determine what you think are the most critical findings related to HR’s future and how these findings relate to your other resources in this activity.

Go to the Collaborate tab and look for a new Discussion post your faculty (or designated peer) created as the main discussion for this activity.

Within that main Discussion area, address the following:

1. Consider the following excerpt from the BSG Perspectives report: Creating People Advantage 2014-2015: How to Set Up Great HR Functions:

Great HR functions have a strong relationship with their internal clients and thus understand the organization’s most urgent needs and strategic goals. This connection allows them to address the day-to-day realities of business units and to meet long-term considerations, such as the supply and quality of employees.

2. In light of resources associated with this activity, combined with your professional experience and your analysis of the report, would you agree with this statement? Why or why not?

3. Please do not limit yourself with the above example. You are encouraged to figure out your own questions and to share your views with your group members and give feedback on their opinions. 

Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.​

results.ActivityInstructions:
Demonstrate your group’s understanding of the balanced scorecard by creating a simple one for a company with which you are familiar.

In your group, select a company with which you are all familiar, and create a simple balanced scorecard that links HR objectives to the company’s corporate strategic objectives. A publicly traded company, with easy access to annual reports and other information, would be best suited for this activity. The video Building the Human Resources Performance Measurement Scorecard (Knowles, 2012) is particularly useful.

DIRECTIONS:

Go to the Resources tab and review all of the Mandatory Resources.

Go to the Collaborate tab and look for a new Discussion post your faculty (or designated peer) created as the main discussion for this activity.

Within that main Discussion area, address the following:
  1. Create a simple balanced scorecard that links HR objectives to the company’s corporate strategic objectives.
  2. Use what you have learned from the other resources in this activity to ensure that all the steps you propose in the scorecard to be taken on HR matters are linked to at least one strategic objective.

Select one person from your group to go to the Submission tab and submit the group’s deliverable by the due date.

Demonstrate your understanding of the drastic changes in the work environment, including changes in organisational structures, the roles of HR, the use of physical space in the office, new competencies, and expectations for collaboration. With these drastic changes taking place, reflect on how the HR function will adapt and survive. You must comment on the impact of those changes and share your ideas about the future of work and workers.

DIRECTIONS:

Go to the Resources tab and review all of the Mandatory Resources.

Answer the following questions based on your study of the resources associated with this activity, and your professional observations and experience:
  1. What are the basic differences you have observed when you compare the career expectations of the generation before you and after you? 
  2. How would you, or your company, attract, build, manage and retain a team when companies cannot rely on coercive power, organisational authority, or physical proximity?
  3. What is the future role of the HR department in such a fragmented talent structure?
Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.


Go to the Submission tab and submit your deliverable by the due date.

results.ActivityInstructions:
Discover something new to ignite your thinking why people organise.

DIRECTIONS:

Go to the Resources tab and watch the media programs. Take notes as you watch.

Consider how you might answer the following questions:
  1. Is life inherently chaotic and random, or is it more based on a predetermined flow? 
  2. How do you mostly deal with uncertainty? Your options are: ignoring, eliminating (using your willpower), or gambling.
  3. Do you feel secure when you feel you’re part of an ‘organisation’? Why or why not?
Search the Internet and your school library for information that will help you to answer these questions.

Go to the Collaborate tab and create a new Discussion post. In your post, share your answers to the questions and links to any websites you found that helped you to answer the questions.

Click on your peers’ Discussion posts and read through them. Select at least two peers and comment on their posts in a way that builds on their discovery thinking.
results.ActivityInstructionsGREEK:
[Unique Activity Title]

Ανακαλύψτε κάτι νέο για να δώσετε έναυσμα στους στοχασμούς σας για [topic].

ΟΔΗΓΙΕΣ:

Μεταβείτε στην καρτέλα Πηγές και παρακολουθήστε τα προγράμματα πολυμέσων. Κρατήστε σημειώσεις ενόσω παρακολουθείτε.

Σκεφτείτε τι απαντήσεις θα δίνατε στις εξής ερωτήσεις:

  • Question
  • Question
  • Question
Αναζητήστε στο διαδίκτυο και στη βιβλιοθήκη της σχολής σας πληροφορίες που θα σας βοηθήσουν να απαντήσετε σε αυτές τις ερωτήσεις.

Μεταβείτε στην καρτέλα Συνεργασία και δημιουργήστε μια νέα δημοσίευση συζήτησης. Στη δημοσίευσή σας, μοιραστείτε τις απαντήσεις που δώσατε στις ερωτήσεις καθώς και τυχόν συνδέσμους που βρήκατε και οι οποίοι σας βοήθησαν να απαντήσετε στις ερωτήσεις.

Επιλέξτε τις δημοσιεύσεις συζήτησης των συμφοιτητών σας και κατόπιν διαβάστε τις. Επιλέξτε τουλάχιστον δύο συμφοιτητές και σχολιάστε τις δημοσιεύσεις τους με τρόπο εποικοδομητικό για τις ανακαλύψεις στις οποίες η σκέψη τους τούς οδήγησε.

results.ActivityInstructions:
Develop your personal interest in the reasons behind organisational management through critical thinking and private coaching from your faculty.

DIRECTIONS:

Go to the Resources tab and review all of the Mandatory Resources.

Select one Mandatory Resource that captures your personal interest. 

Go to the Collaborate tab and create a new Discussion post. In your post, write a brief critique of the Mandatory Resource you selected. Begin your post by identifying the resource and explaining why you selected it.

Read your faculty’s comments and engage in further discussion with your faculty to deepen your understanding and expand your critical thinking in this area.​

[Unique Activity Title]

Αναπτύξτε το προσωπικό σας ενδιαφέρον για μια πτυχή του [unit topic title] μέσω κριτικής σκέψης και ατομικής καθοδήγησης από το διδακτικό προσωπικό.

[extended activity introduction if desired; delete this if none]

ΟΔΗΓΙΕΣ:

Μεταβείτε στην καρτέλα Πηγές και εξετάστε όλες τις Υποχρεωτικές πηγές.

Επιλέξτε μία από τις υποχρεωτικές πηγές που αποτυπώνει τα προσωπικά σας ενδιαφέροντα.

Μεταβείτε στην καρτέλα Συνεργασία και δημιουργήστε μια νέα δημοσίευση συζήτησης. Στη δημοσίευσή σας, γράψτε μια σύντομη κριτική της υποχρεωτικής πηγής που έχετε επιλέξει. Αρχίστε τη δημοσίευσή σας προσδιορίζοντας την πηγή και εξηγώντας γιατί την επιλέξατε.

Διαβάστε τα σχόλια του διδακτικού προσωπικού και συμμετέχετε σε περαιτέρω συζητήσεις με το διδακτικό προσωπικό για να εμβαθύνετε τις γνώσεις σας και να επεκτείνετε την κριτική σας σκέψη σε αυτό τον τομέα.

results.ActivityInstructions:
Talk with your peers to increase your understanding of how why we get organized.

DIRECTIONS:

Go to the Resources tab and review all of the Mandatory Resources.

Go to the Collaborate tab and look for a new Discussion post your faculty (or designated peer) created as the main discussion for this activity.

Within that main Discussion area address the following:
  1. Observing the behaviours in the organisations you are familiar with, how do people cope with the cognitive overload? Share whether you think that these behaviours are healthy for the organisation or not.
  2. Which organisation theory perspective (modern, symbolic, postmodern) provides the best answer to the question: Why do we get organised in today’s world? Justify your answer.
  3. In the last slide, write your own question to the group based on the ideas presented in the resources associated with the activity.
Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.

results.ActivityInstructions:
Talk with your peers to increase your understanding of mapping an organisation.

DIRECTIONS:

Go to the Resources tab and review all of the Mandatory Resources.

Go to the Collaborate tab and look for a new Discussion post your faculty (or designated peer) created as the main discussion for this activity.

Within that main Discussion area, address the following:
  1. Each individual of your group must pick an existing company to study. This can be a company you are working for or a company in which someone you can interview is working. Once you have chosen an organisation, investigate the organisational structure and its strategy. Create an organisational chart representing the company. You should keep the names of the organisation and its members anonymous. Once the organisation chart is ready, evaluate how relevant it is to the organisation’s strategy (strategy according to you, your opinion matters).
  2. Upon completing your map, share it along with your evaluation of how relevant it is to the organisation’s strategy with your group members. Read the posts of your group and compare the organisation charts they shared with your own. Share any insights you gained from their organisation charts and evaluation of strategy.
Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.

results.ActivityInstructions:
Demonstrate your individual understanding of change and the organisation by writing a 1.000-word essay about change in impacting an industry.

DIRECTIONS:

Go to the Resources tab and review all of the Mandatory Resources.

Do research on your own to learn more about this topic.

Then, select an industry with which you are familiar and write a 1.000-word essay on the following questions: 
  1. What are the change opportunities/threats in the status quo for organisations in this industry that are forcing organisations within it to change? In your answer, explore whether the changes are coming from the natural environment, a society (regulations), competitors, or from within the organisation.
  2. What are the challenges that come from within an organisation when it decides to change its organisational structure?
Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.

Go to the Submission tab and submit your deliverable by the due date.

results.ActivityInstructions:
Demonstrate your group’s understanding of managing change in the organisation by analysing an organisation and creating a 1.000- to 1.200-word report.

DIRECTIONS:

Your group must select an organisation that is, or has been, a ‘changing’ organisation. It can be an organisation you or a member of the group has worked for, or it can be an organisation that the group can access via a published case study or by interviewing someone at the organisation.

Go to the Resources tab and review all of the Mandatory Resources.

Go to the Collaborate tab and look for a new Discussion post your faculty (or designated peer) created as the main discussion for this activity.

Within that main Discussion area, address the following:
  1. What was the strategic vision behind the change?
  2. Were the eight steps referred to by Kotter International part of the change process? Note any steps that appear to be missing or any additional steps taken by the organisation.
  3. Has the new organisational structure been appropriate for achieving the aims of the strategic vision? Why or why not? 
Select one person from your group to go to the Submission tab and submit the group’s deliverable by the due date.

results.ActivityInstructions:
​Creativity is that characteristic of human behaviour that seems the most mysterious yet most critical to human advancement. The capacity to solve problems in new ways and to produce works that are novel, appropriate and socially valued is an ability that has fascinated people for centuries (Mateus, 2015).

 

Does this matter for business? Absolutely! According to Kearon (2008): 'Creativity is the lifeblood of business and for marketing in particular it is the alpha and omega of commercial success and ultimately financial rewards'.

 

Develop your personal interest in an aspect of creativity through critical thinking and private coaching from your faculty.

 

  1. Go to the Resources tab and review all of the Mandatory Resources.

  2. Select one Mandatory Resource that captures your personal interest.

  3. Go to the Collaborate tab and create a new Discussion post. In your post, write a brief critique of the Mandatory Resource you selected. Begin your post by identifying the resource and explaining why you selected it.

  4. Read your faculty's comments and engage in further discussion with your faculty to deepen your understanding and expand your critical thinking in this area.

Helpful Tools:

  • Brainstorm Graphic Organizers Objective: Create lists of the new ideas and concepts by structuring, connecting and deep diving in the subjects.
  • Brainstorming Webs: Develop a central concept or question and identify its characteristics, supporting facts and related ideas.
  • Tree Diagrams: Communicate hierarchy, a classification system or relationships between main and supporting ideas.
  • Flow Diagrams: Document a sequence of events, represent the actions or processes of different actors in a system, communicate a process or show cause and effect of interrelated elements.

results.ActivityInstructions:
Talk with your peers to increase your understanding of 'design thinking' and creative techniques and tools.

  1. Go to the Resource tab and review the resources associated with the activity. ​

  2. Go to the Collaborate tab and look for a new Discussion post your faculty (or designated peer) created as the main discussion for this activity. 

  3. Within that main Discussion area, answer the following:

    • ​create the best idea solution for a proposed challenge (challenge will be given by your local Tutor) in a limited time period.

  4. Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.
​

Helpful Tools:

  • Brainstorm Graphic Organizers Objective: Create lists of the new ideas and concepts by structuring, connecting and deep diving in the subjects.
  • Brainstorming Webs: Develop a central concept or question and identify its characteristics, supporting facts and related ideas
  • Tree Diagrams: Communicate hierarchy, a classification system or relationships between main and supporting ideas.
  • Flow Diagrams: Document a sequence of events, represent the actions or processes of different actors in a system, communicate a process or show cause and effect of interrelated elements.
  • Affinity Diagramming Objective: Encourage students to store tacit knowledge to integrate in the final work through the capture of insights, observations, concerns or requirements on individual notes to consider on the final conclusions.
  • Image Boards Objective: Encourage students to collect pictures, illustrations or imagery can be used to visually communicate the conclusions to the target
  • Concept Mapping Objective: Through visual frameworks, maps and info-graphics, ask students to create maps of concepts, ideas and conclusions. This will help them to visualize the complexities of a system and assist them as they make and break connections, study existing connections, and expand on what is already understood but possibly taken for granted within a particular system.

results.ActivityTitle: Is Creativity and Innovation Part of Everyone's Job?
results.ActivityInstructions:
Demonstrate your individual understanding of is creativity and innovations part of everyone's job in the workplace by writing a report, conducting individual research and reflecting on your practical experiences.​

  1. Go to the Resources tab and review the resources associated with the activity.
  1. Do research on your own to learn more about this topic.
  1. Complete the following:

    1. Based on your own practical experiences in the workplace, write a report of 1.000 words reflecting on main points of the article, relating them to your organisation and the following questions:
      • Why is creativity everyone's job?
      • I am not creative. Why do I have to support and execute creative work for my company?
      • What is the benefit for the company?
      • Is this really an evolution of the working processes inside business organisations? What are the jumps you identified?
      • Does it work for your own company? Or where you work? If not, why?

  1. Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.

  2. Go to the Submission tab and submit your deliverable by the due date.

results.ActivityTitle: Changing the Way People Manage Knowledge
results.ActivityInstructions:
​

Moving to a systematic management of knowledge is a culture change process. You will be introducing a culture where knowledge is seen as important to the organisation's success, and where accessing and sharing knowledge becomes an automatic routine process. This requires a change in the way people think and behave.

Develop your personal interest in an aspect of leading the culture change in regards to knowledge management through critical thinking and private coaching from your faculty.

  1. Go to the Resources tab and review all of the Mandatory Resources.

  2. Select one Mandatory Resource that captures your personal interest.

  3. Go to the Collaborate tab and create a new Discussion post. In your post, write a brief critique of the Mandatory Resource you selected. Begin your post by identifying the resource and explaining why you selected it.

  4. Read your faculty's comments and engage in further discussion with your faculty to deepen your understanding and expand your critical thinking in this area.​

results.ActivityInstructions:
​In this activity you will study some organisational models for the implementation of innovation centres such as corporate labs and Living Labs.

You will be presented with models that are connected with external resources such as networking and partnerships that allow organisations to have scale and scope for deeper and more profound research and innovation development.

 

Develop your personal interest in an aspect of living labs through critical thinking and private coaching from your faculty.

  1. Go to the Resources tab and review all of the Mandatory Resources.

  2. Select one Mandatory Resource that captures your personal interest.

  3. Go to the Collaborate tab and create a new Discussion post. In your post, write a brief critique of the Mandatory Resource you selected. Begin your post by identifying the resource and explaining why you selected it.

  4. Read your faculty's comments and engage in further discussion with your faculty to deepen your understanding and expand your critical thinking in this area.

results.ActivityTitle: HP: Imprinting the Global Health Sector
results.ActivityInstructions:
Demonstrate your individual understanding of social innovation by writing a paper, conducting individual research and reflecting on your practical experiences.

  1. Go to the Resources tab and review the resources associated with the activity.

  2. Do research on your own to learn more about this topic.

  3. Complete the following:​

    • Reflect on what you have learnt in this unit and, based, on your own practical experiences in the workplace, write a report of 1.000 words reflecting on main points of the case study, relating them to your organisation and the following questions:
      • How would you convince the HR management that this project fits into the organisation's new CRS approach?
      • How can this new approach to social innovation create new opportunities for the business?
      • How can you tie the outcomes back to the HP business?

  4. ​ Include references to relevant Resources for this activity and any other information that you researched on your own.

  5. ​ Go to the Submission tab and submit your deliverable by the due date.

​

results.ActivityTitle: What do YOU need to do to become an Inspirational Leader?
results.ActivityTitleGREEK: Τι είναι αυτό που ΕΣΕΙΣ χρειάζεστε για να εξελιχθείτε σε ηγέτη-πηγή έμπνευσης;
results.ActivityInstructions:
Discover something new to ignite your thinking about discovering who you are as a leader and becoming an inspiring leader.

DIRECTIONS:

  1. Go to the Resources tab and watch the media programs. Take notes as you watch
  2. Consider how you might answer the following questions:
    • What are the timeless elements of leadership in your opinion? What are the leadership differentiators in the 21st century? Why?
    • What innovative leadership challenges can help prepare the next generation of leaders—both individually and as teams? Why?
    • How do we enable leaders to be open to new learning models about leadership with new paradigms? How do we enable leaders to unlearn past models?
  3. Search the Internet and your school library for information that will help you to answer these questions.
  4. Go to the Collaborate tab and create a new Discussion post. In your post, share your answers to the questions and links to any websites you found that helped you to answer the questions.
  5. Go to the Collaborate tab and click on your peers' Discussion posts and read through them. Select at least two peers and comment on their posts in a way that builds on their discovery thinking.
results.ActivityInstructionsGREEK:
Ανακαλύψτε κάτι νέο για να δώσετε έναυσμα στους στοχασμούς σας για την ανακάλυψη της ηγετικής σας φυσιογνωμίας και για να γίνετε ένας ηγέτης που εμπνέει τους άλλους.

ΟΔΗΓΙΕΣ:

1.       Μεταβείτε στην καρτέλα Πηγές και παρακολουθήστε τα προγράμματα μέσων. Κρατήστε σημειώσεις ενόσω παρακολουθείτε

2.       Σκεφτείτε τι απαντήσεις θα δίνατε στις εξής ερωτήσεις:

  1. Ποια είναι, κατά την άποψή σας, τα διαχρονικά χαρακτηριστικά της ηγετικότητας; Ποιοι παράγοντες διαφοροποιούν την ηγετικότητα στον 21ο αιώνα; Γιατί;
  2. Ποιες νέες προκλήσεις ηγετικότητας μπορούν να προετοιμάσουν την επόμενη γενιά ηγετών, τόσο σε ατομικό όσο και σε ομαδικό επίπεδο; Γιατί;
  3. Πώς θα επιτρέψουμε στους ηγέτες να είναι δεκτικοί στα νέα μοντέλα εκμάθησης για την ηγετικότητα με νέα πρότυπα; Πώς θα επιτρέψουμε στους ηγέτες να "ξεμάθουν" όλα τα παλαιότερα πρότυπα;

3.       Αναζητήστε στο διαδίκτυο και στη βιβλιοθήκη της σχολής σας πληροφορίες που θα σας βοηθήσουν να απαντήσετε σε αυτές τις ερωτήσεις.

4.       Μεταβείτε στην καρτέλα Συνεργασία και δημιουργήστε μια νέα δημοσίευση για Συζήτηση. Στη δημοσίευσή σας, μοιραστείτε τις απαντήσεις που δώσατε στις ερωτήσεις καθώς και τυχόν συνδέσμους που βρήκατε και οι οποίοι σας βοήθησαν να απαντήσετε στις ερωτήσεις.

5.       Μεταβείτε στην καρτέλα Συνεργασία, επιλέξτε τις δημοσιεύσεις για Συζήτηση των συμφοιτητών σας και κατόπιν διαβάστε τις. Επιλέξτε τουλάχιστον δύο συμφοιτητές και σχολιάστε τις δημοσιεύσεις τους με τρόπο εποικοδομητικό για τις ανακαλύψεις στις οποίες η σκέψη τους τούς οδήγησε.

results.ActivityTitle: What do YOU need to do to become a Respected, Trustworthy and Empathic Leader?
results.ActivityTitleGREEK: Τι είναι αυτό που ΕΣΕΙΣ χρειάζεστε για να εξελιχθείτε σε έναν ηγέτη που απολαμβάνει σεβασμό, θεωρείται αξιόπιστος και διαθέτει ικανότητα συναισθηματικής κατανόησης και ταύτισης;
results.ActivityInstructions:
​Discover something new to ignite your thinking about discovering how to build positive relationships with team members and becoming a respected, trustworthy and empathic leader.

DIRECTIONS:

  1. Go to the Resources tab and watch the media programs. Take notes as you watch
     
  2. Consider how you might answer the following questions:
    • How are organisations leveraging their strategic and economic challenges as opportunities to choose, develop and retain more adaptive leaders in social cultural dynamic systems?
    • How does a person build relationships with others, while reinforcing organisational identity and becoming a charismatic leader who is accepted and followed by others? 
    ​
  3. Search the Internet and your school library for information that will help you to answer these questions.
     
  4. Go to the Collaborate tab and create a new Discussion post. In your post, share your answers to the questions and links to any websites you found that helped you to answer the questions.
     
  5. Go to the Collaborate tab and click on your peers' Discussion posts and read through them. Select at least two peers and comment on their posts in a way that builds on their discovery thinking.

  4. Αναζητήστε στο διαδίκτυο και στη βιβλιοθήκη της σχολής σας πληροφορίες που θα σας βοηθήσουν να απαντήσετε αυτές τις ερωτήσεις.

results.ActivityTitle: What do YOU need to do to become an Influential Leader?
results.ActivityTitleGREEK: Τι είναι αυτό που ΕΣΕΙΣ χρειάζεστε για να εξελιχθείτε σε ηγέτη με επιρροή;
results.ActivityInstructions:
Discover something new to ignite your thinking about how to network effectively and becoming an influential leader.

  1. Go to the Resources tab and watch the media programs. Take notes as you watch

  2. Consider how you might answer the following questions:

    • ​How do we create measurable links between leadership appointments and their impact on value creation and network-sustained competitive advantages?
    • How do leaders become impactful beyond the current scope of organisational digital engagement and promote sustained business growth?

  3. Search the Internet and your school library for information that will help you to answer these questions.

  4. Go to the Collaborate tab and create a new Discussion post. In your post, share your answers to the questions and links to any websites you found that helped you to answer the questions.

  5. Go to the Collaborate tab and click on your peers' Discussion posts and read through them. Select at least two peers and comment on their posts in a way that builds on their discovery thinking.​
results.ActivityInstructionsGREEK:

results.ActivityTitleGREEK: Αναπτύξτε τον ηγετικό σας χαρακτήρα
results.ActivityInstructions:
To begin developing your leadership persona, you will complete a Personality survey as a self-assessment to help you discover what kind of leader you are now so that you can use that information as the basis for becoming the leader you want to be.

DIRECTIONS:

  1. Complete this MMBI Personality Survey to discover your personality type: http://www.teamtechnology.co.uk/mmdi/questionnaire/

  2. Take notes and reflect on your insights from completing the self-assessment survey.

  3. Read the resources to learn more about how your MMBI personality type relates to leadership characteristics.

  4. Do your own research to learn more about this topic.
    ​​
  5. Meet with your Leadership Coach to discuss the outcome of the self-assessment and how you can apply it to enhance your leadership persona.
results.ActivityInstructionsGREEK:
Για να αρχίσετε να αναπτύσσετε τον ηγετικό σας χαρακτήρα, θα συμπληρώσετε ένα ερωτηματολόγιο για την προσωπικότητά σας ως μέσο αυτο-αξιολόγησης για να ανακαλύψετε τι είδους ηγέτης είστε τώρα και να χρησιμοποιήσετε τις πληροφορίες αυτές ως αφετηρία για να γίνετε ο ηγέτης που θέλετε να είστε.

ΟΔΗΓΙΕΣ:

  1. Συμπληρώστε αυτό το ερωτηματολόγιο προσωπικότητας MMBI για να ανακαλύψετε τον τύπο της προσωπικότητάς σας: http://www.teamtechnology.co.uk/mmdi/questionnaire/
  2. Κρατήστε σημειώσεις και αναλογιστείτε τα διδάγματα από την ολοκλήρωση αυτού του ερωτηματολογίου αυτο-αξιολόγησης.
  3. Μεταβείτε στην καρτέλα Πηγές και μελετήστε όλες τις Υποχρεωτικές πηγές για να μάθετε περισσότερα σχετικά με το πώς ο τύπος προσωπικότητας MMBI στον οποίο ανήκετε συνδέεται με τα ηγετικά χαρακτηριστικά.
  4. Κάντε τη δική σας έρευνα για να μάθετε περισσότερα σχετικά με αυτό το θέμα.
  5. Συναντηθείτε με τον καθοδηγητή ηγετικότητας για να συζητήσετε το αποτέλεσμα της αυτο-αξιολόγησης και τον τρόπο με τον οποίο μπορείτε να τα αξιοποιήσετε για να ενισχύσετε τον ηγετικό σας χαρακτήρα.

results.ActivityTitleGREEK: Αναπτύξτε τις ηγετικές σας σχέσεις
results.ActivityInstructions:
​To further develop your leadership persona, you will complete a Servant and Positive Leadership survey to help you discover how leaders serve their teams and the community so that you can use that information to grow into the leader you want to be.

  1. ​​​Read the document "Introduction to the Servant and Positive Leadership Survey." 

  2. ​​​Complete the Servant and Positive Leadership Survey to discover how leaders serve and what you need to do to become an empathetic leader.

  3. Take notes and reflect on your insights from completing the survey.

  4. Read the resources to learn more about servant leadership, positive leadership and psychological safety and how it relates to leadership relationships.

  5. Do your own research to learn more about this topic.

  6. Meet with your Leadership Coach to discuss the outcome of the survey and how you can apply it to enhance your leadership persona.
results.ActivityInstructionsGREEK:
​Για να αναπτύξετε την ηγετική σας προσωπικότητα περαιτέρω, θα συμπληρώσετε ένα ερωτηματολόγιο για την Υπηρετική και θετική ηγετικότητα που θα σας βοηθήσει να μάθετε πώς οι ηγέτες υπηρετούν τις ομάδες τους και την κοινότητα έτσι ώστε να χρησιμοποιήσετε αυτές τις πληροφορίες για να εξελιχθείτε στον ηγέτη που θέλετε να γίνετε.

ΟΔΗΓΙΕΣ:

  1. Μεταβείτε στην καρτέλα Συνεργασία και διαβάστε το έγγραφο "Εισαγωγή στο Ερωτηματολόγιο για την υπηρετική και θετική ηγετικότητα".
  2. Συμπληρώστε το Ερωτηματολόγιο για την υπηρετική και θετική ηγετικότητα στην καρτέλα Πηγές για να ανακαλύψετε τον τρόπο με τον οποίο οι ηγέτες υπηρετούν και το τι χρειάζεστε να να γίνετε ένας ηγέτης με ικανότητα συναισθηματικής κατανόησης και ταύτισης.
  3. Κρατήστε σημειώσεις και αναλογιστείτε τα διδάγματα από την ολοκλήρωση του ερωτηματολογίου.
  4. Μεταβείτε στην καρτέλα Πηγές και μελετήστε όλες τις Υποχρεωτικές πηγές για να μάθετε περισσότερα σχετικά με την υπηρετική ηγετικότητα, τη θετική ηγετικότητα και την ψυχολογική ασφάλεια και τον τρόπο με τον οποίο αυτή συνδέεται με τις σχέσεις ηγετικότητας.
  5. Κάντε τη δική σας έρευνα για να μάθετε περισσότερα σχετικά με αυτό το θέμα.
  6. Συναντηθείτε με τον καθοδηγητή ηγετικότητας για να συζητήσετε το αποτέλεσμα του ερωτηματολογίου και τον τρόπο με τον οποίο μπορείτε να τα αξιοποιήσετε για να ενισχύσετε τον ηγετικό σας χαρακτήρα.

results.ActivityTitleGREEK: Ανάπτυξη των επαφών ηγεσίας
results.ActivityInstructions:
To further develop your leadership persona, you will complete a Thinking Styles survey to help you discover how leaders connect their teams to other teams and the community so that you can use that information to develop into the leader you want to be.

  1. Take this Thinking Styles Survey to discover how leaders motivate employees by understanding different thinking styles and what you need to do to become a leader that utilises thinking styles to motivate.

    • ​Link to Survey: http://web.mit.edu/10.27/www/Team-Building/Forms/thinksty.html

  2. Take notes and reflect on your insights from completing the survey.

  3. Read the resources to learn more about thinking styles and how they relate to leadership.

  4. Do your own research to learn more about this topic.

  5. Meet with your Leadership Coach to discuss the outcome of the survey and the resources to determine how you can apply your key learnings to enhance your leadership persona.​
